To expand the boundary of Fort Frederica National Monument in the State of Georgia, and for other purposes.
Fort Frederica National Monument Boundary Expansion Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Mr. Lamborn moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 494.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Murkowski with amendments. With written report No. 115-114.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 151.

bill.summary:
Fort Frederica National Monument Boundary Expansion Act
(Sec. 2) This bill expands the boundary of the Fort Frederica National Monument on St. Simons Island, Georgia, and increases the maximum number of acres that may be included in the monument from 250 to 305 acres.
The Department of the Interior may acquire, by donation or purchase, the land and interests within the monument only from willing sellers.
Interior may not acquire land or interests by condemnation or eminent domain.
